Definitions.Paraphrase:
[C] a person who begins or supports a political revolution 
革命者
Lenin was a revolutionary. 
列宁是一个革命者。

of political revolution; involving a complete or dramatic change 
革命的，突破性的
He suffered for his revolutionary principles. 
他曾为自己的革命原则蒙受苦难。
Penicillin was a revolutionary drug. 
青霉素是一种突破性的药物。

[C] the person who is elected to be the leader of the government group in a town or city 
市长

express one's choice or opinion, esp. by officially marking a paper or by raising one's hand or speaking in a meeting 
投票，选举，表决
The representatives voted against / for the bill. 
代表们投票反对/支持这个议案。
The committee members voted that the meeting should be adjourned. 
委员会成员投票决定会议休会。
Labour was voted in for second term office. 
工党被投票选出再次组阁。

[C] 
投票（结果），选举（结果）；选票；选举权
I shall cast my vote for the only woman candidate at the election. 
选举时我将把票投给那名惟一的女性候选人。 
The vote yesterday went in his favour. 
昨天的表决他领先。
In Britain, young people are given the vote at the age of 18. 
在英国，青年人18岁开始享有选举权。

[U] (the direction or region) halfway between north and east 
(在)东北(的)
The chilly wind is coming from the northeast. 
寒风来自东北方向。

toward the northeast 
朝东北方向（地）
They sailed northeast for several days. 
他们向东北航行已有几天了。
At this point the road turns northeast. 
路在这儿转向东北。

1. [U] political affairs or life 
政治职业，政治事业
He is planning to retire from politics next year. 
他打算明年退出政坛。
The group is campaigning to get more women into politics. 
这个组织正发起运动以让更多的妇女从政。
2. [U] the study of the ways in which a country is governed 
政治，政治学
She's reading politics at Beijing University. 
她在北京大学攻读政治学。

[C] a person who takes the opposite in a game, competition, etc. 
敌手，对手
Finally, turn your body slightly, so that you face the opponent directly. 
最后稍微转一下身体，这样你就直接面对着你的对手。
In some countries, any opponent of the government is likely to lose their job. 
在有些国家，与政府作对的人有可能失去工作。

understand wrongly; put a wrong meaning on
误解，误会
So she had not misunderstood; she had not misheard.
这么说来她没有误解，她没有听错。

[C,U] the act of putting a wrong understanding on sth. 
误解，误会
There may be communication difficulties or misunderstanding, on either or both parts, in which case improvements in these areas need to be sought.
在两者中一方或双方可能有沟通上的困难或误解，这就需要在这些方面加强交流。
This can lead to misunderstanding, mutual frustration, anger and perhaps quarrelling. 
这会导致误解、彼此之间的失望、愤怒甚至争吵。

1. [C] (fig.) a representative
代表，代理人
Your CV is your ambassador, and must represent you well when you try to get a job. 
你的简历就是你的代言人，在你求职时它必须能充分展示你自己。
2.[C] a diplomat of the highest rank who is the official representative of one's country
大使，使节
The Ambassador replied that he realized that no statement could be made on this subject. 
大使答复说他认识到在这个问题上无法作任何声明。

[C] a small bag used by a woman to carry her money and personal things
（女用）手提包
The search through her handbag brought no success. 
对她手提包进行的搜查也没有什么结果。

[C,U] the action or an instance of choosing by vote one or more of the candidates for a position, esp. a political office 
选举
The Democratic Party has launched a nationwide election campaign. 
民主党发起了全国范围的竞选运动。
Local government elections will take place in May. 
地方政府选举将在5月举行。
In America, presidential elections are held every four years. 
在美国，总统选举每四年举行一次。

[C] a person who works hard to achieve social or political change, esp. as an active member of a political organization 
积极参与者；活动家
The Greenpeace activists protested against the commercial killing of the whales. 
绿色和平组织成员抗议对鲸鱼进行商业捕杀。
He's been a trade union activist for many years. 
他多年来一直是工会的积极分子。

[C] the words that sb. says or thinks when they are praying 
祷文，祷词
He says his prayers every night before he goes to bed. 
他每晚就寝前做祷告。
We thought he had been killed in the war, but our prayers were answered when he arrived home unexpectedly. 
我们以为他已经死在战争中了，但他意外的回家应验了我们的祈祷。

[C] a person who in the past had experience in the stated form of activity
经验丰富的人，老手
The veteran actor has said he is ready to direct a film for the first time.
这位经验丰富的演员说过他已经准备好首次导演一部电影。

[C] a large bag, usu. of strong rough cloth, strong paper, or plastic, used for storing or carrying flour, coal, vegetables, grain, etc. 
袋，包
The corn was stored in large sacks. 
玉米存放在大布袋中。
There was a sack of potatoes / coal / flour in the corner of the barn. 
在谷仓的角落里有一袋土豆/煤/面粉。

dismiss from a job
解雇
The teacher was sacked because he could not meet the standards set by the college. 
这个教师因不能达到学校的要求而被解雇了。

[U] powder made from grain, esp. wheat, used for making bread, cakes, etc.
面粉，谷物磨的粉
This loaf of bread is made of wholemeal flour.  
这个面包是由全麦面粉做的。

[C] (a unit of mass equal to) 0.001kilogram 
克
This bag of flour weighs 500 grams. 
这包面粉重500克。

[C] a single mass of bread shaped and baked in one piece
（一个）面包
Store the loaf in a tin and slice it when needed. 
把面包储藏在一个罐子里，需要时再切成片。

waste time, esp. when one is not working when they should 
游荡，闲逛
You thought I only worked part-time and the rest of the time I just loafed around. 
你以为我只部分时间工作，其余时间只是在闲逛。

1. put (seeds) in or on the ground so that plants will grow 
播种
Sow the seeds in pots. 
把种子播种在花盆里。
When is the best time to sow? 
什么时候是最佳播种时期？
We'll sow this field with wheat. 
我们要在这块田里播种小麦。
2. spread or introduce feelings, ideas, etc. 
散布，激起
sow the seeds of hatred 
撒下仇恨的种子
Now that you've sown doubts in my mind, I'll never be sure I can trust him. 
既然你在我心中撒下了怀疑的种子，我很难再信任他了。

1. (pl.) soldiers on duty in a large group 
(常用复数) 部队，军队
regular troops 
正规军
When the riots did not stop, the troops were sent in to deal with the situation. 
暴乱仍未停止，军队被派去控制局面。
2. [C] a large group of people or animals, esp. when moving 
一群，一队，（一）大批
a troop of school children
一大队学童
There were troops of friends to send him off. 
有许多朋友来为他送行。

of, relating to or possessing a colony or colonies 
殖民的，殖民地的
The people on the Pacific islands have successfully fought against colonial rule. 
太平洋岛屿上的人民成功地进行了反对殖民统治的斗争。

1. trying very carefully to keep sth., or extremely careful in protecting sb. or sth. 
惟恐失去的，小心守护的
She is very jealous of her independence, and doesn't want to get married. 
她很珍惜自己的独立，不想结婚。
He kept a jealous eye on his property. 
他小心守护着自己的财产。
2. unhappy and angry because sb. has sth. one wants, or because one thinks they might take sth. 
妒忌的
Her colleagues are jealous of her success. 
她的同事们妒忌她的成功。

1.[C] a group of people meeting together, esp. to discuss matters of national importance 
集会者；议会
the United Nations General Assembly 
联合国大会
The national assembly has / have met to discuss the crisis. 
已经召开了国民议会来讨论这次危机。
2.[U] the meeting together of a group of people for a specific purpose 
集会，聚会
That anti-government organization was denied the right of assembly. 
那个反政府组织被剥夺了集会的权利。
3.[U] the action or process of fitting together the parts of sth. 
装配，安装
The assembly of cars is often done by machines. 
汽车的装配通常由机器来完成。

[C] a small group of people chosen to represent a larger organization and either make decisions or gather information 
委员会
She sits on / is on the school's development committee. 
她是学校发展委员会的成员。
The local council has just set up a committee to study recycling. 
当地议会刚刚成立了一个委员会来研究资源再生利用问题。

[C] an action or event that causes a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval 
丑行，丑闻
She was at the center of a public scandal last year. 
她是去年一场社会丑闻的中心人物。
They tried to cover up the scandal. 
他们试图掩盖这桩丑闻。
The newspaper exposed the scandal. 
这家报刊披露了这一丑闻。

showing strong feeling or energetic activity; strong and powerful; physically violent and frightening 
激烈的，强劲的，凶猛的
There is a fierce competition for those scholarships. 
对这些奖学金的竞争十分激烈。
Those fierce animals lived in the forests many years ago. 
这些猛兽许多年前生活在森林中。

[C] a public meeting of a large group of people, esp. supporters of a particular opinion 
群众集会，群众大会
5,000 people held a protest march and rally against sexual discrimination.
5,000人集会游行抗议性别歧视。
Rallies are being held across the country to celebrate the victory. 
全国各地都在集会庆祝胜利。

[C] a noisy, violent, and uncontrolled public gathering 
暴乱，骚乱
A riot broke out at the stadium when the home team lost 5-0. 
当主队以0比5输了时，体育馆内发生了骚乱。
The football match led to an uncontrolled riot. 
这场足球赛导致了一场无法控制的骚乱。

[C] a long piece of cloth with a sign on it, often stretched between two poles, carried by people taking part in an activity 
旗帜，横幅
The banners of many countries fly outside the headquarters of the United Nations. 
许多国家的国旗在联合国总部外面飘扬。
The marchers' banners all said "We want work" . 
游行者的横幅上都写着"我们要工作"。

1. [C] a person who sees an event happening, esp. a crime or an accident 
(尤指犯罪或事故等的)目击者
According to the witnesses, the robbery was carried out by two teenage boys. 
据目击者说，抢劫者是两个十几岁的男孩。
She was a witness to the tragic event. 
她目睹了这一悲惨事件。
2. [C] a person in a law court who states what he knows about a legal case or a particular person 
（法庭上的）证人
Ten witnesses are expected to testify at the trial today. 
预计10名证人将在今天的审讯中作证。
He will attend the court as a witness. 
他将作为证人出庭。

see sth. happen, esp. a crime or accident, because of being present when it happens 
目击，见证
They witnessed several street battles. 
他们目击了几起巷战。
This university has witnessed quite a few changes over the years. 
这所大学多年来已经经历了相当大的变革。

serious or determined 
认真的，坚决的，严肃的
At school he was very earnest but he's more relaxed now. 
过去在学校时他很严肃，不过现在随和多了。
They are earnest about their studies. 
他们学习非常勤奋。

[C] (= dorm) a large room or building containing many beds, esp. in a boarding school or university 
集体宿舍，学生宿舍
a school dormitory 
一座学校宿舍

[C] 
伞，雨伞，太阳伞
Put your umbrella up. It's going to rain. 
把伞撑起来，要下雨了。

1. [C,U] 
柠檬；柠檬汁
2. [U] 
淡黄色

[C] a male ruler of an empire 
皇帝

give new energy and strength to (sb.) or make (sb.) less hot 
使振作精神，使恢复活力，使清凉
A shower always refreshed me on hot days. 
大热天冲一下淋浴总是使我倍感清新。
Having had a good sleep, he felt thoroughly refreshed. 
他睡了个好觉，感到精神已完全恢复。
He refreshed himself with a cup of coffee. 
他喝了一杯咖啡来提神。

making one feel stronger, less tired or more alert; pleasantly new or different 
令人精神振奋的，令人感到新鲜的
a refreshing sleep 
令人解乏的好觉
a refreshing change 
别开生面的变化
It's a refreshing chance to see a losing team shaking hands and smiling after a match. 
赛后看到一支输了球的球队队员握手和微笑是件新鲜事。

[C] 
洋葱头，洋葱

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
try to get elected to a public position 
竞选
He said he was not going to run for president this time.
他说他这次不打算竞选总统。
Last May he announced he would run for the governor. 
去年5月他宣布要竞选州长。

elect (sb.) by voting
投票选出
He was voted in as treasurer. 
投票结果他当选财务主管。
If he fails he would have little excuse in the eyes of those who voted him in. 
如果他不成功，是无法向那些投票选他的人们解释的。

going to each house in a street or area 
挨家挨户地
He is distributing the free samples from door to door. 
他正挨家挨户地分发免费样品。

look after 
照料，照顾
Who's taking care of the children while you're away? 
你不在的时候谁照顾孩子们？
She takes great care of her clothes. 
她对衣服十分爱惜。

watch secretly 
监视
Have you been spying on me? 
你一直在监视我吗？
He said that someone might be spying on the station and the pilot was ordered to keep track of the strange object. 
他说可能有人对基地进行侦察,于是便命令飞行员跟踪这个不明物体。

not include in an activity 
把……排斥在外
Mum, Ben keeps shutting me out of the bedroom! 
妈妈，本总是不让我进卧室。
I wanted to shut John out of my life forever. 
我想让约翰永远退出我的生活。

have / get the advantage or control over 
占优势，占（……的）上风，胜过
The government was beginning to get the upper hand. 
政府开始占上风了。
It was easy to see who has the upper hand. 
很容易看出谁占上风。

form the whole of 
构成，组成
Girls make up 56% of the student population. 
女生占学生人数的56%。
One hundred years make up a century. 
100年构成一个世纪。

disperse or scatter (people), often by force 
驱散，解散
The meeting broke up at eleven o'clock. 
会议是11点钟散的。
The police broke up the fighting crowd. 
警察驱散了打架的人群。

remove or pull down roughly 
撕下，拆毁
They are going to tear down these old buildings. 
他们打算拆掉这些旧住房。
He tore down the engine in order to repair it. 
他把发动机拆开修理。

used to emphasize that sth. is clearly different from sth. else 
对比之下，相比之下
When you look at their new system, ours seems very old-fashioned by contrast. 
如果你看到他们的系统，相形之下我们的系统就太过时了。
He was friendly and talkative; she, by contrast, said nothing.
他很友好，也很健谈；而她什么也没说。

seriously and sincerely 
认真地
The work on the house will begin in earnest on Monday. 
建造那座房子的工作周一正式开始。
You may laugh but I'm in deadly earnest. 
你可以笑，但我绝对是认真的。

feel pleased and satisfied about sth. that one owns or has done or is connected with 
对……感到自豪，对……感到光荣
Your achievements are something to be proud of. 
你的成就是值得骄傲的。
He was proud of himself for not giving up. 
他为自己没有放弃而感到自豪。

spread (sth.), as to view 
摆出，张开
She was busy laying the food out on the table. 
她忙着把食品摆放在桌子上。
He laid the map out on the table. 
他在桌上把地图摊开。

feel as if ; want (sth. or doing sth.) 
感觉好像；想要
I felt like a fool when I answered wrong. 
当我答错了时我感觉自己像个傻瓜。
I feel like a drink. 
我想喝一杯。
We all felt like celebrating. 
我们都想庆祝一下。

guard or take care of 
照顾，看管
The guards were hired to watch over the houses.
雇用那些卫兵是看管房子的。
It was my duty to watch over the children. 
照看那些孩子是我的职责。

carry out or complete a task as expected, or fulfill a promise
履行诺言，不负众望
We expected great things of the England team, but on the day they simply failed to deliver the goods. 
我们对英国队寄予厚望，但那一天他们有负众望。
As long as you deliver the goods, he will always trust you. 
只要你履行诺言，他会永远信任你的。
阿加莎·墨丹妮·姆波戈（人名）
